settings.title: What is incontinence?
settings.text: Incontinence is the inability to voluntarily control the retention of your urine or faeces. It is a common condition that can be caused by pregnancy/vaginal birth, obesity, family history or increasing age. It's usually due to the weakening or damage of the muscles that are used for urination and excretion.

settings.title: How is incontinence managed?
settings.text: There are several options that can be used to treat incontinence. They can include dietary and lifestyle changes, bowel or bladder training, medication, exercises or surgery. The use of incontinence products, such as a pad or pants, may also be used daily to manage symptoms.

settings.title: What causes incontinence?
settings.text: Incontinence can be caused by pregnancy, urinary tract infections, medications, constipation or severe medical conditions. Individuals suffering from a pelvic disorder, stroke, diabetes, or menopause can also have incontinence problems.

settings.title: What are symptoms of incontinence?
settings.text:
Common symptoms of incontinence include:

1. Loss of bladder control

2. Blood in urine

3. Frequent urge to urinate

4. Passing fewer quantities of urine

5. Pain while urinating

settings.title: What medication can I use to treat incontinence in the elderly?
settings.text: Depending on the type of incontinence that you are suffering from, medications, absorbent pads, catheters or devices to prevent leakage can be used to tackle incontinence.

settings.title: How do I get diagnosed with incontinence?
settings.text: Physical examination by the GP, urinary test for any infections or other tests can help confirm incontinence in individuals.

settings.title: What is an online consultation?
settings.text: An online consultation checks if you are eligible to purchase the product. Some products only require an online consultation which approximately takes 1 minute to complete, enabling you to buy the product. Other products will also require a prescription; in this case, you will need to complete the online consultation, and then one of our partner pharmacy prescribers or doctors will review the online consultation questions and approve the order for delivery if you are eligible to purchase the item.

settings.title: Can I return my order?

For medicinal products, you are eligible to cancel the order only until it has been dispatched. From that point forward, you are no longer eligible to return the order.
